newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico labor leader to leave hospital soon - doctor.
newsitem.headline: Mexico labor leader to leave hospital soon - doctor.

text.p: Mexico's powerful labor leader Fidel Velazquez will remain in the hospital until the middle of the week, but is mainly in good health, his doctor said on Monday.
The 97-year old labor baron, leader of the six million-strong Confederation of Mexican Workers (CTM), was admitted to hospital on June 5 with a urinary tract infection.
"He is improving, but his sodium and potassium levels are low. He will stay in hospital two or three more days," his doctor, Salomon Jasqui, told Reuters in a telephone interview.

The frail labor leader had lost 22 pounds (10 kg) over the last six months as a result of a series of illnesses. But Jasqui said that with the help of a nutritionist he had regained about four pounds (two kg).
"He is doing well and he is following the (July 6) elections very closely and says he intends to vote," Jasqui added.
Velazquez has been a pillar of the ruling Institutional Revolutionary Party for more than half a century, repeatedly key swinging labour support behind the government.
